rules: Rule1: Either a chef has substance in flavoring or the chef becomes successful.
Rule2: If a chef opens a restaurant specializing in fine dining, then the chef gets promoted to head chef.
Rule3: A chef publishes a cookbook of signature recipes or appears on TV in a cooking show.
Rule4: Whenever a chef appears on TV in a cooking show, the chef opens a restaurant specializing in fine dining.
Rule5: If a chef lacks creativity, then the chef repeats menus.
Rule6: Provided that a chef lacks creativity, it is not the case that the chef has imagination.
Rule7: If a chef attends a workshop on fusion cuisine, then either the chef innovates dishes or the chef does not follow recipes.
Rule8: A chef attends a workshop on fusion cuisine or studies abroad in France.
Rule9: Whenever a chef studies abroad in France, either the chef innovates dishes or the chef does not follow recipes.
Rule10: A chef practices the technique of knife skills or practices the technique of plating.
Rule11: Provided that a chef practices the technique of plating, the chef becomes successful.
Rule12: If a chef burns food, then the chef overcooks a meal.
Rule13: Whenever a chef burns food, it is not the case that the chef ruins a dish.
Rule14: Under the condition that a restaurant gets a complaint about food quality, the restaurant does not lose a regular customer.
Rule15: A chef experiments with flavors or tries ingredients that are exotic.
Rule16: Provided that a chef tries ingredients that are exotic, either the chef innovates dishes or the chef does not follow recipes.
Rule17: Whenever a chef prepares food in entrees, an apprentice acquires skill in cooking.
Rule18: A chef prepares food in entrees or the chef creates artwork in plated dishes or the chef does not have substance in flavoring.
Rule19: A chef completes training in an advanced course or gets certification as a master chef.
Rule20: Under the condition that a chef gets certification as a master chef, the chef does not remain an amateur.
Rule21: If a chef repeats menus, then a restaurant bores customers.
Rule22: Provided that a chef visits a farmers' market, either the chef updates specials on a weekly basis or the restaurant does not bore customers.
Rule23: A chef visits a farmers' market or researches current trends.

Rule24: Whenever a chef analyzes feedback from customer reviews, if the chef researches current trends then either the chef updates specials on a weekly basis or the restaurant does not bore customers.
Rule25: A chef analyzes feedback from customer reviews or adjusts recipes.
Rule26: If a chef adjusts recipes, then the chef improves dishes.
Rule27: Provided that a chef improves dishes, if the chef researches current trends then either the chef updates specials on a weekly basis or the restaurant does not bore customers.
Rule28: If a restaurant maintains quality, then if a chef lacks creativity then the chef has imagination.
Rule29: If a chef sources ingredients locally, then the chef follows standards of hygiene.
Rule30: If a restaurant perfects service, then the restaurant designs ambiance.
Rule31: A restaurant perfects service or trains staff in the front house.
Rule32: A chef masters the technique of sautéing or masters the technique of baking.

Rule33: If a restaurant trains staff in the front house, then if it is not the case that if the chef follows standards of hygiene then the restaurant maintains quality, then the restaurant fails inspection by the health department.
Rule34: Whenever a restaurant designs ambiance, the restaurant earns a Michelin star.
Rule35: Under the condition that a chef wastes ingredients, the chef ruins a dish.
Rule36: Provided that a chef tracks inventory of supplies, if the chef monitors costs related to food then if the chef overcooks a meal then the chef wastes ingredients.
Rule37: If a chef masters the technique of baking, then the chef becomes successful.
Rule38: Whenever a chef wins a competition at a regional contest, if the chef masters the technique of sautéing then the chef becomes successful.
Rule39: Under the condition that a chef gets a promotion to head chef, the chef wins a competition at a regional contest.
Rule40: If a chef receives an award for culinary excellence, then the chef gets a promotion to head chef.
Rule41: If it is not the case that if a chef publishes a cookbook of signature recipes then the chef receives an award for culinary excellence, then the chef fails in business with a restaurant.
Rule42: Provided that it is not the case that if a chef lacks creativity then the chef has imagination, the chef follows recipes.
Rule43: If it is not the case that if a chef practices the technique of knife skills then the chef becomes successful, then the chef burns food.
Rule44: Under the condition that it is not the case that if a chef overcooks a meal then the chef ruins a dish, the restaurant loses a regular customer.
Rule45: If it is not the case that if a chef overcooks a meal then the chef ruins a dish, then the restaurant gets a complaint about food quality.
Rule46: Provided that it is not the case that if a chef experiments with flavors then either the chef innovates dishes or the chef does not follow recipes, the chef creates a signature unique dish.

Rule47: Under the condition that it is not the case that a chef joins an association like a culinary guild or, if it is not the case that if a chef experiments with flavors then either the chef innovates dishes or the chef does not follow recipes, then the chef does not create a signature unique dish, the chef remains an amateur.
Rule48: If it is not the case that if a chef completes training in an advanced course then the chef does not remain an amateur, then the chef does not stay in a junior position.

Rule49: Under the condition that it is not the case that if a chef follows standards of hygiene then the restaurant maintains quality, the restaurant does not fail inspection by the health department.

Rule50: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if a chef completes training in an advanced course then the chef does not remain an amateur then the chef stays in a junior position, the chef achieves fame.
Rule51: If a chef does not become successful, then the chef lacks creativity.
facts: Fact1: A chef sources ingredients locally.
Fact2: A chef monitors costs related to food.
Fact3: A chef tracks inventory of supplies.
Fact4: It is not the case that a chef fails in business with a restaurant.
Fact5: A chef does not innovate dishes.
Fact6: A chef does not create artwork in plated dishes.
Fact7: A chef does not join an association like a culinary guild.
Fact8: A chef does not achieve fame.
Fact9: A chef does not update specials on a weekly basis.
Fact10: An apprentice does not acquire skill in cooking.
Fact11: A restaurant does not earn a Michelin star.
